news.headline: Q4 PC Shipments Rise 9.6%, Memory Shortage to Hurt Growth in 2026
news.summary: The global PC market ended 2025 on a strong note, with fourth-quarter shipments increasing 9.6% year over year to 76.4 million units. Lenovo LNVGY retained its market-leading position with 19.3 million shipments and a 25.3% market share, up
news.article_text:
The global PC market ended 2025 on a strong note, with fourth-quarter shipments increasing 9.6% year over year to 76.4 million units, according to the data compiled by International Data Corporation (“IDC”). The data was impressive and marked the ninth consecutive quarter of year-over-year growth.

However, the near-term prospects of the PC industry seem highly volatile, given the ongoing global memory shortages, which could lead to potential market contraction and significant price increases.

news.headline: Netflix's Bid to Acquire Warner Bros. Discovery Just Got a Boost From an Unlikely Source
news.summary: Netflix is considering making an all-cash offer for Warner Bros.' studio and streaming assets. The remaining assets of the company, namely the legacy cable and broadcast television stations, would be spun off. The value of these Discovery Global shares may ultimately tip the balance in Netflix's favor.
news.article_text:
To win over undecided shareholders, the streaming giant is also considering an all-cash offer.

In early December, Netflix (NFLX +0.75%) agreed to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD +0.10%) in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $72 billion. The move kicked off a high-profile battle that has raged ever since, and the ensuing drama has the makings of a made-for-streaming movie. Since then, Paramount Skydance (PSKY 0.41%) has been doing its level best to scuttle the deal, eager to pick up Warner Bros

news.headline: Paramount Skydance Names Cinelli CFO Amidst Fight for Warner Bros.
news.summary: Dennis Cinelli will be tasked with overseeing Paramount’s global financial functions, including accounting, tax and investor relations.

news.headline: Trump Shares Post Accusing Netflix Of Being 'Woke' — Is President Signaling He Won't Support Warner Bros. Merger?
